content.prompt: One end of a string is attached to the ceiling with the other end attached to a toy. The toy can be set into motion such that it travels in a horizontal circular path at a constant tangential speed, as shown above. The toy experiences a component of the tension force toward the center of the circular path that serves as the centripetal force exerted on the toy. Which of the following measurements could a student use to determine the net centripetal force exerted on the toy? Select two answers.

choices.label: Use a scale to determine the mass of the toy. Use a protractor to determine the angle θ between a vertical line and the angle that the string makes with the vertical line.
Use a stopwatch to determine the time for the toy to complete one revolution. Use a meterstick to measure the radius of the toy’s circular path, R. Use a scale to determine the mass of the toy.

Use a stopwatch to determine the time for the toy to complete one revolution. Use a meterstick to determine the length, l, of the string. Use a meterstick to measure the radius of the toy’s circular path, R.
Use a stopwatch to determine the time for the toy to complete one revolution. Use a meterstick to determine the length, l, of the string. Use a scale to determine the mass of the toy.
